resources.string: PCOS (also called the Stein-Leventhal syndrome), is an endocrine and metabolic disorder that affects women of reproductive age. A state of hormonal imbalance in the body takes place when a male hormoneâ€“androgen is produced much above normal levels which lead to the disruption in the development and the release of eggs during ovulation; hirsutism; acne and the growth of cysts on the ovaries. It affects the normal metabolic process which is indicated by abrupt weight gain and tiredness among PCOS patients.

Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) has become as common as common cold these days in women aging towards puberty. Living with PCOS can be both embarrassing and anxiety-ridden, as symptoms ranging from the growth of facial hair to infertility affect women from the outside and inside. Risk factors associated with PCOS are Infertility or Subfertility, Endometrial Cancer (Endometrial Carcinoma), Diabetes, Lipid Abnormalities, Cardiovascular Risks. According to [4], women diagnosed with PCOS are twice as likely to be hospitalized for heart disease, diabetes, mental health conditions, reproductive disorders, and cancer of the uterine lining.
We can help you to find out whether you are suffering from PCOS or not. We will ask you some questions related to your lifestyle and our model can predict the result.
Were you overweight according to your Body Mass Index?
Lets start with your name and age.
Your age at which you had PCOS.
Have you experienced significant or rapid weight gain and faced difficulty in losing it ?
Have you experienced irregular or missed periods ?
Rate your hair growth in the mentioned areas :
Hair thinning or hair loss problems ?
Dark patches on the back of your neck or underarms ?
Feeling of tiredness all the time ?
Mood Swings more often than usual ?
How many days in a week did you exercise ?
How many times a week did you eat outside ?
Did you consume canned food more often ?
Did you move to a different city/location before experiencing the above conditions ?
